Decorate LFQData with Methods for transforming Intensities

Source: R/LFQData.R
LFQDataTransformer.Rd

Decorate LFQData with Methods for transforming Intensities

Decorate LFQData with Methods for transforming Intensities

Public fields

lfq

LFQData object

Methods

Public methods

  • LFQDataTransformer$new()

  • LFQDataTransformer$log2_robscale()

  • LFQDataTransformer$log2_robscale_subset()

  • LFQDataTransformer$intensity_array()

  • LFQDataTransformer$intensity_matrix()

  • LFQDataTransformer$clone()

Method new()

initialize

Usage

LFQDataTransformer$new(lfqdata)

Arguments

lfqdata

LFQData object to transform

Method log2_robscale()

log2 transform and robust scale data

Usage

LFQDataTransformer$log2_robscale(colname = "transformedIntensity")

Arguments

colname

name of transformed column

Returns

LFQData

Method log2_robscale_subset()

log2 transform and robust scale data based on subset

Usage

LFQDataTransformer$log2_robscale_subset(
  lfqsubset,
  colname = "transformedIntensity"
)

Arguments

lfqsubset

LFQData subset to use for normalization

colname

- how to name the transformed intensities, default transformedIntensity

Returns

LFQData

Method intensity_array()

Transforms intensities

Usage

LFQDataTransformer$intensity_array(.func = log2)

Arguments

.func

transformation function working with arrays e.g. log2, log10, asinh etc.

Returns

LFQDataTransformer (self)

Method intensity_matrix()

pass a function which works with matrices see robust_scale for examples.

Usage

LFQDataTransformer$intensity_matrix(.func = robust_scale)

Arguments

.func

any function taking a matrix and returning a matrix (columns sample, rows feature e.g. base::scale) default robust_scale

Returns

LFQDataTransformer (self)

Method clone()

The objects of this class are cloneable with this method.

Usage

LFQDataTransformer$clone(deep = FALSE)

Arguments

deep

Whether to make a deep clone.

Examples

library(tidyverse)
library(prolfqua)


rm(list = ls())
library(prolfqua)
#source("c:/Users/wewol/prog/prolfqua/R/LFQData.R")
istar <- prolfqua::data_ionstar$filtered()

#> Column added : nr_peptide_Id_IN_protein_Id
data <- istar$data %>% dplyr::filter(protein_Id %in% sample(protein_Id, 100))
lfqdata <- LFQData$new(data, istar$config)

lfqcopy <- lfqdata$clone()
lfqTrans <- lfqcopy$get_Transformer()

x <- lfqTrans$intensity_array(log2)

#> Column added : log2_peptide.intensity
x$lfq$config$table$is_intensity_transformed

#> [1] TRUE
x <- x$intensity_matrix(robust_scale)

#> Joining, by = c("protein_Id", "sampleName", "peptide_Id")
plotter <- x$lfq$get_Plotter()
plotter$intensity_distribution_density()

#> Warning: Removed 2460 rows containing non-finite values (stat_density).

# transform by asinh root and scale
lfqcopy <- lfqdata$clone()
lfqTrans <- lfqcopy$get_Transformer()
x <- lfqTrans$intensity_array(asinh)

#> Column added : asinh_peptide.intensity
x$lfq$config$table$is_intensity_transformed

#> [1] TRUE
x <- lfqTrans$intensity_matrix(robust_scale)

#> Joining, by = c("protein_Id", "sampleName", "peptide_Id")
plotter <- x$lfq$get_Plotter()
plotter$intensity_distribution_density()

#> Warning: Removed 2460 rows containing non-finite values (stat_density).
